data.title: Torvald's quotes
data.solution:
<?php
$Q = stream_get_line(STDIN, 150 + 1, "\n");
$W = stream_get_line(STDIN, 150 + 1, "\n");

$W = explode(",", $W);
$Q = explode("?", str_replace("#", "?", $Q));

for($i=0;$i<count($Q);$i++) {
    echo $Q[$i].(isset($W[$i]) ? $W[$i] : '');
}
data.statement: Find the patern to Help Linus !

testCases.title: Test 1
testCases.testOut: Talk is cheap. Show me the code.

testCases.title: Validator 1

is,Show

testCases.title: Test 2
testCases.testIn:
Most ? programmers do ? not because they expect to get paid or get adulation by the ?, but ? it is fun to program.

testCases.testOut: Most good programmers do programming not because they expect to get paid or get adulation by the public, but because it is fun to program.

testCases.title: Validator 2

Most good ? do programming not because they expect to get paid or get adulation by the public, ? because it is ? to ?.
programmers,but,fun,program
testCases.testOut: Most good programmers do programming not because they expect to get paid or get adulation by the public, but because it is fun to program.

testCases.title: Test 3
testCases.testIn:
Bad # worry about the code. Good programmers # about data structures and # relationships.
programmers,worry,their
testCases.testOut: Bad programmers worry about the code. Good programmers worry about data structures and their relationships.

testCases.title: Validator 3
testCases.testIn:
# programmers worry about the code. Good programmers # about data structures and their #.
Bad,worry,relationships
testCases.testOut: Bad programmers worry about the code. Good programmers worry about data structures and their relationships.

testCases.title: Test 4
testCases.testIn:
Theory and # sometimes clash. And when that #, theory loses.Every single #.
practice,happens,time
testCases.testOut: Theory and practice sometimes clash. And when that happens, theory loses.Every single time.

testCases.title: Validator 4
testCases.testIn:
Theory and practice # clash. And when that happens, # loses.Every # time.
sometimes,theory,single
testCases.testOut: Theory and practice sometimes clash. And when that happens, theory loses.Every single time.

data.stubGenerator:
read Q:string(150)
read W:string(150)
write answer
data.outputDescription: The actual phrase that Torvald wanted to say which is a string.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Find the patern to Help Linus !
Input
Line 1 : Q a string...
Line 2 : W another string...
Output
The actual phrase that Torvald wanted to say which is a string.
Constraints
0<=len(Q),len(W)<=150
Example
Input
? is ?. Show me the ?.
Talk,cheap,code
Output
Talk is cheap. Show me the code.
